Don't bar campus drinkers

The proposed alcohol levy will combat anti-social behaviour in town, but just isn't appropriate for campus.

Higher education: privilege or human right?

A Southerner in York

I don't care for regional pride, because I believe the logical extension of these is arbitrary conflict, like the clashing of football firms or religious sects.

York's political apathy

This university's lack of interest in campus politics is a dire shame, yet we are being given the opportunities to make a huge difference to our experiences here.

Remembering Mental Health

We should ensure that the issue of student mental health does not get forgotten.

Sex work: respect choices but provide support where it is sought

York students turning to sex work reveals the strains of student finance.

The Oxford price tag

Calls for further fee rises from Oxford University's Vice-Chancellor is an unpopular and foolish idea.

Resisting the Rising Fees

The move to raise university fees to PS16,000 cannot be supported.

York needs to take charge of where the money goes

We desperately need to change this disparity between ethical consumption and ethical investment. We wouldn't buy something which we knew had been made using forced labour, so why do people still invest in it?

Swansea University's pole exercise ban is severely misguided

Pole exercise societies do not play into the hands of the sex industry, they are supportive, athletic and a provide a source of self confidence and happiness.

Niall Whitehead explores Boris Johnson's latest controversial comments.

A recent promotional event at a club in Leeds allows the issue of LAD culture to rear its ugly head once more.

Genetics: the science of success?

Being mindful of mental health

Student mental health is being largely ignored, yet an NUS survey has revealed that it is a widespread issue across the British student population.

Accepting the label of a 'mature student' takes courage, but it comes with its own advantages

Zain Mahmood responds to Ellie Rice's attack on the STYC system.

Will more Wednesdays end in Ziggy's than Salvation?

Ziggy's secures the top spot for the Wednesday "end-of-night venue" and just under 1 in 10 students don't cook any of their own meals. Fiona Parker examines the latest Nouse polls.

The state of student employment

'Human zoo' betrays a skewed Vision of mental health

<em>Vision</em>'s article, which likened the event to a 'human zoo', has been met by fierce controversy, with several students deeming the terminology used 'offensive', and others believing those interviewed to have a misguided conception of what the event will entail.

Come dine with the VC

The perversion of the freshers experience

For the modern generation, bed -post notches are worn like badges of honour, hangovers with pride rather than shame, and promiscuous individuals are given hearty pats on the back by their giggling mates as last night's 'conquest' scurries down the hall back to wherever they came from, with panda eyes and ripped tights.

Treat the conspiracies with caution

Diana was shot by the third tower on the grassy knoll because we never went to the moon!

GTA backlash is boring now

Video games tapped into a need for vicariously blowing things up usually only fulfilled by inept scientists and drone controllers. It's hard to know what people did to dissipate their explosive urges before GTA but the consistently falling murder rate would suggest it was actually killing people, and that's science.

The road to Salvation?

A college too far

Welcome, freshers

Taking credit for hardship funds

It is very easy to be generous with other people's money ...

Our culture of careerism

What is the intrinsic value of careerism exactly? I have no plans to pursue a career in academic philosophy, but I also have no plans to stop reading or writing about it. Is the worth of my interest so diminished by its lack of financial benefits?

Shambles on the Shambles

If we can't save our cobbles, perhaps we should learn a lesson about town planning and pay more attention to future schemes put forward by the council.
